alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 7:10PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Laramie County through 800 PM MDT... At 709 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near North Cheyenne, or 8 miles north of Cheyenne, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Ranchettes, Frontier Park, North Cheyenne, Warren Af Base, Warren AFB and Fox Farm-College. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 10 and 22. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 367 and 374. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills
